page.title: 09THE VILLAGE HALL-FIRE!!!
page.content: On Saturday 27th April 1985 at Marsh Baldon, the Village Hall burnt down. There was a bonfire quite near to it and the wind had blown some sparks onto it. First of all the kitchen caught fire. Mr.Polly went inside to get out the gas bottles as he was scared that they might have blown up. Four fire crews arrived quickly but nothing could be done to save the timber building, a First World War army hut. We could feel the heat on us.The flames crackled and they were very high too. The water-pressure is low in Baldon and at the School a fire appliance sucked water from the pond. The firemen hacked the fence away, then drained the ditch. Already people are busy raising money to build a new hall. There is to be an open meeting in August to decide what the villagers want in the way of a meeting place;what to do for the best.
